column4: saw post on apache config. Did you modify /etc/apache2/sites-available/default file?
at one time i think i did
i did everything everyone here is telling me i just dont know where i messed up or if i missed something
at this point, browsing still gets you at /var/www/ directory?
yes www.boscoslife.com still points to /var/www
ok. "cd" to /etc/apache2/sites-available. And see what the file "default" says.
http://pastebin.com/m673faf80
ah well, w/o making it all too complicated, that's the one that had to be edited. (but I see you already have) After this edit, you did "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart" ?
yes i did
ok. In /etc/apache2/apache2.conf it says "include /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/" ?
i have 3 websites i need to do this for 2 of them ned to be done now
/etc/apache2/sites-available# ls default  default-ssl  default.save  www.boscoslife.com
ah, ok. Well actually you should be able to "define" those different sites in the sites-available directory.
also, pls see /var/log/apache2/error_log after restarting the apache server. Helpful information might be there
so what am i doing wrong
I don't know yet.. have you checked /var/log/apache2/error_log after restarting apache?
yes and nothing was there
nothing? Only the "resuming normal operations" ?
yes
that 'proves' that your changes have not had *any* effect...
so either apache hasn't been restarted, or something else is overriding the DocumentRoot
allthough I think your config is correct (at least for the default file) i agree w/ deany.. they might be able to help you even better
